text: You will have to create your User class for this to work tho so you are able to populate your source, if you don't want to, you can always use a List<DataRow> in your DataTableSource instead of a List<User> and manually map each cell.

This is broken for UTF-16 strings that contain surrogate pairs, i.e. characters outside of the basic multilingual plane. It will also give funny results for strings containing combining chars, e.g. a diaeresis might appear on the following character. The first issue will lead to invalid unicode strings, the second to valid strings that look funny.
